get.description:
OSPFv3 (Open Shortest Path First version 3) is a routing protocol which is
described in RFC5340 entitled OSPF for IPv6. It is a Link State-based IGP
(Interior Gateway Protocol) routing protocol. It is widely used with medium to
large-sized enterprise networks.

The characteristics of OSPFv3 are:

- Provides a loop free topology using SPF algorithm.
- Allows hierarchical routing using area 0 (backbone area) as the top of the
  hierarchy.
- Supports load balancing with equal cost routes for same destination.
- OSPFv3 is a classless protocol and allows for a hierarchical design with
  VLSM (Variable Length Subnet Masking) and route summarization.
- Scales enterprise size network easily with area concept.
- Provides fast convergence with triggered, incremental updates via
  Link State Advertisements (LSAs).

post.description: OSPFv3 configuration profiles for organizing router instances.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Profile name for the OSPFv3 configuration group.

get.description: OSPFv3 configuration profiles for organizing router instances.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Profile name for the OSPFv3 configuration group.

patch.description: OSPFv3 configuration profiles for organizing router instances.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Profile name for the OSPFv3 configuration group.

delete.description: OSPFv3 configuration profiles for organizing router instances.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Profile name for the OSPFv3 configuration group.

delete_object_type.name: object_type
delete_object_type.description: LOCAL - To delete local objects. SHARED - To delete shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

delete_scope_id.name: scope_id
delete_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

delete_persona.name: persona
delete_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be deleted. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_object_type.name: object_type
post_object_type.description: LOCAL - To create local objects. SHARED - To create shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

post_scope_id.name: scope_id
post_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

post_persona.name: persona
post_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be created. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_object_type.name: object_type
patch_object_type.description: LOCAL - To update local objects. SHARED - To update shared objects. Default - Defaults to SHARED if not provided

patch_scope_id.name: scope_id
patch_scope_id.description: Scope at which local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

patch_persona.name: persona
patch_persona.description: Persona for which the local object needs to be updated. Mandatory if object_type = LOCAL. Should not be provided for object_type = SHARED.

get_object_type.name: object_type
get_object_type.description: Retrieves LOCAL or SHARED or both(default) configuration objects.

get_scope_id.name: scope_id
get_scope_id.description: Configuration at a given scope. Mandatory for view_type = LOCAL.

get_persona.name: persona
get_persona.description: Filters configuration specific to given persona type. If not provided and view_type = LOCAL, then defaults to all persona.

effective.name: effective
effective.description: True - Returns effective configuration (i.e hierarchically merged configuration). False - Returns committed configuration at a given scope.

detailed.name: detailed
detailed.description: True - Includes annotations in the returned json to indicate the type of object, scope, and persona. False - Returns only config objects without annotations.

view_type.name: view_type
view_type.description: LIBRARY - Returns shared objects in library. For LIBRARY, all other parameters listed below, except 'detailed' , will be ignored. LOCAL - Returns configurations for a scope and one or more persona based on parameters below.

schema.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

schema.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

ArubaOspfv3_Ospfv3Schema.description:
OSPFv3 (Open Shortest Path First version 3) is a routing protocol which is
described in RFC5340 entitled OSPF for IPv6. It is a Link State-based IGP
(Interior Gateway Protocol) routing protocol. It is widely used with medium to
large-sized enterprise networks.

The characteristics of OSPFv3 are:

- Provides a loop free topology using SPF algorithm.
- Allows hierarchical routing using area 0 (backbone area) as the top of the
  hierarchy.
- Supports load balancing with equal cost routes for same destination.
- OSPFv3 is a classless protocol and allows for a hierarchical design with
  VLSM (Variable Length Subnet Masking) and route summarization.
- Scales enterprise size network easily with area concept.
- Provides fast convergence with triggered, incremental updates via
  Link State Advertisements (LSAs).

profile.description: OSPFv3 configuration profiles for organizing router instances.

name.description: Profile name for the OSPFv3 configuration group.

description.description: Description of the OSPFv3 profile purpose and configuration.

routers.description: The list of all the OSPFv3 Router instances.

instance-tag-vrf.description: Key combination of instance-tag and vrf separated by ~

router-id.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
router-id.description: The router identifier for the OSPFv3 instance.

areas.description:
The list of all the OSPFv3 area for the OSPFv3 router instance.

An area in OSPFv3 is a logical collection of routers, links and
OSPFv3 networks that have the same area ID. Areas are used to divide
an OSPFv3 network into sub-domains. The main benefit of creating areas
is that it reduces the number of routes that need to be propagated.

distance.description:
OSPFv3 distance.

Administrative Distance is used as criteria to select the source of the
route when the same route is learned from different routing protocols.
Optionally, Administrative Distance can be set for each OSPFv3 route type
intra-area, inter-area, and external type-5 and type-7 routes.

max-metric.description:
sets the protocol to advertise a maximum metric so that other
routers do not prefer the router as an intermediate hop in their shortest
path first (SPF) calculations.
- `include-stub` option configures the router to advertise maximum
  metric for links including stub links in router LSA.
- `on-startup` option configures the router to advertise maximum metric in
  router LSA at startup for the time mentioned in seconds or for
  a default value of 600 seconds.
- `include-stub` and `on-startup` options together configure the router
  to advertise maximum metric for links including stub links in router LSA at
  startup for the time mentioned in seconds or for a default value of 600 seconds.

passive-interface-default.description:
All OSPFv3 enabled interfaces to be passive.
An OSPFv3 passive interface is a network interface
that does not send or receive OSPFv3 Hello packets,
but still participates in the routing process for subnet advertisement.

redistribute-routes.description: Redistribute routes from other sources into this OSPFv3 instance.

maximum-paths.description: Maximum number of equal cost paths that are stored for each destination in the Routing table.

graceful-restart-cfg.description:
Graceful restart OSPF.
If `strict-lsa-check` option is mentioned, the router
will not perform strict LSA check when acting as a restart helper
for a restarting peer. By default, router will participate
in the graceful restart of a neighbor with strict LSA check enabled.

reference-bandwidth.description: The reference bandwidth, Mbits/second, for interface cost calculations.

default-info-originate.description:
Generate a default external route into an ospfv2 routing domain.
Only one among 'always', 'metric', 'always-metric' can be configured

active-backbone-stub.description: Advertise default route to stub if loopback in backbone area.

summary-aggregate-route.description:
Summarizes the external routes with the matching address or masks.
When advertising this route, its, metric would be set to the lowest
cost path from among the routes that were summarized.
With no-advertise flag enabled, Suppress routes that match the
specified prefix/mask pair.
Only works for ASBR(Autonomous System Boundary Router).

route-filter.description:
Used to filter routes from being installed in the routing table or
redistributed into another routing protocol.
When inbound direction is used it filter routes to be installed in the routing table.
Outbound direction will filter only the desired redistributed routes from other protocols.
The prefix-list which is provided in command will be used to filter routes for both
inbound and outbound direction. Configuration is not allowed if the referenced
prefix-list has not yet been configured.

items.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 prefix represented in full, shortened, or mixed
shortened format followed by a slash and CIDR mask
(0 <= mask <= 128).
items.description: Restrict redistribution of routes via OSPF.

x-enumDescriptions.TYPE1: Comparable (an OSPFv3 metric plus the external metric)

prefix.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 prefix represented in full, shortened, or mixed
shortened format followed by a slash and CIDR mask
(0 <= mask <= 128).
prefix.description: Prevent redistribution of routes via OSPF.

nonstop.description: Enables or disables nonstop forwarding for OSPFv3.

ANY.description: Any of local or shared config object.

ArubaOspfv3_Redistribute.description: Redistribute routes from other sources into this OSPFv3 instance.

interface-name.description: L3 interface name where ospfv3 is enabled.

lag-name.description: Lag interface name where ospfv3 is enabled.

sub-interface-name.description: L3 subinterface name where ospfv3 is enabled.

svi-id.x-typeDescription: Type definition representing a single-tagged VLAN
svi-id.description: L3 SVI id  where ospfv3 is enabled.

loopback-id.description:
L3 loopback id where ospfv3 is enabled.
Loopback interface only support cost network and disable configuration

tunnel-id.description: L3 tunnel id where ospfv3 is enabled.

hello-interval.description: Time interval between hello packets configuration on an interface.

dead-interval.description: Interval to consider an unresponsive neighbor as down on an interface.

retransmit-interval.description: Time between retransmitting lost link state advertisements configuration on an interface.

transit-delay.description: Link state transit delay configuration on an interface.

network.x-typeDescription: The network type for the interface.

bfd.description: Enable BFD in OSPFv3 for VLAN specific IP address

authentication.description: OSPFv3 IPsec AH authentication configuration on an interface.

spi-id.description: Security Parameters Index (SPI) for the Security Association (SA) configuration on an interface.

authentication-type.description: OSPFv3 authentication type configuration on an interface.

key-type.description: OSPFv3 key type configuration on an interface.

auth-key.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.
auth-key.description: Plaintext authentication key for OSPFv3, configured on the interface.

auth-cipher-key.description: Ciphertext authentication key for OSPFv3, configured on the interface.

encryption.description: OSPFv3 encryption method configuration on an interface.

encryption-type.description: OSPFv3 encryption type configuration on an interface.

encryption-key-type.description: OSPFv3 encryption key type configuration on an interface.

encryption-key.description: Plaintext encryption key for OSPFv3, configured on an interface.

encr-cipher-key.description: Ciphertext encryption key for OSPFv3, configured on an interface.

ether-interfaces.description: OSPFv3 interface configuration on a routed physical interface.

lag-interfaces.description: OSPFv3 interface configuration in a routed LAG.

sub-interfaces.description: OSPFv2 interface configuration in sub interface.

svi-interfaces.description: OSPFv3 interface configuration in svi interface.

loopback-interfaces.description: OSPFv3 interface configuration in loopback interface.

tunnel-interfaces.description: OSPFv3 interface configuration in tunnel interface.

remote-abr-id.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.
remote-abr-id.description: Router ID of the remote Area Border Router(ABR).

hello-interval.description: Interval between hello packets configuration on an virtual-link.

dead-interval.description: The interval to consider an unresponsive neighbor as down on an virtual-link.

retransmit-interval.description: The interval between retransmitting lost link state advertisements configuration on an virtual-link.

transit-delay.description: Link state transit delay configuration on an virtual-link.

authentication.description: OSPFv3 IPsec AH authentication configuration on an virtual-link.

spi-id.description: OSPFv3 authentication security Parameters Index (SPI) for the Security Association (SA) configuration on an virtual-link.

authentication-type.description: OSPFv3 authentication type configuration on an virtual-link.

key-type.description: OSPFv3 authentication key type configuration on an virtual-link.

auth-key.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.
auth-key.description: Plaintext authentication key for OSPFv3, configured on virtual-link.

auth-cipher-key.description: Ciphertext authentication key for OSPFv3, configured on virtual-link.

encryption.description: OSPFv3 encryption method configuration on an virtual-link.

encryption-type.description: OSPFv3 encryption type configuration on an virtual-link.

encryption-key-type.description: OSPFv3 encryption key type configuration on an virtual-link.

encryption-key.description: Plaintext encryption key for OSPFv3, configured on virtual-link.

encr-cipher-key.description: Ciphertext encryption key for OSPFv3, configured on virtual-link.

ArubaOspfv3_AggregateRoute.description: Summarizes the external routes with the matching address or masks.

prefix.x-typeDescription:
An IPv6 prefix represented in full, shortened, or mixed
shortened format followed by a slash and CIDR mask
(0 <= mask <= 128).
prefix.description: Specify the prefix/mask for advertising the aggregate route

no-advertise.description: Do not advertise the aggregate route.

tag.description: Assign a tag for the aggregate route.

spf-throttle.description: Throttling for Shortest Path First (SPF) calculation.

hold-time.description:
Minimum hold time between two consecutive SPF calculations.
hold-time should be greater than start-time

max-wait-time.description:
Maximum wait time between two consecutive SPF calculation.
max-wait-time should be greater than hold-time

lsa-throttle.description: Throttling timers for link-state advertisement(LSA) generation.

hold-time.description: Minimum hold time between two consecutive LSA generation.

max-wait-time.description: Maximum wait time between two consecutive LSA generation.

ignore-lost-interface.description: Enable the restarting device to ignore lost OSPFv3 interfaces during a graceful restart process.

helper-strict-lsa-check.description: Enable the router as graceful-restart helper for strict LSA check.

helper.description: Enable the router as graceful-restart helper.

ArubaOspfv3_Range.description: Do not advertise the range outside the area.

prefix-area-range-type.description: Key combination of prefix and area-range-type separated by ~

router-lsa.description: Advertise Router-LSAs with maximum metric value.

include-stub.description: Advertise Router-LSAs with maximum metric value for stub links.

on-startup.description: Advertise Router-LSAs with maximum metric value at system startup.

all.description: The administrative distance applies to all types of routes.

inter-area.description: The administrative distance applies to inter area routes.

intra-area.description: The administrative distance applies to intra area routes.

external.description: The administrative distance applies to external routes.

oneOf.x-typeDescription:
An IPv4 address in dotted quad notation using the default
zone.

area-id.description: The Area ID can be in IPv4 address format or in decimal format.

x-enumDescriptions.STUB_NO_SUMMARY: OSPFv3 area as stub with no-summary
x-enumDescriptions.NSSA_NO_SUMMARY: OSPFv3 area as NSSA with no-summary

area-type.description:
This defines how the external routing and summary LSAs for this area will be handled.
Backbone area(0 or 0.0.0.0) can not be configured as stub or nssa.

default-metric.description:
The cost metric for the default summary route sent into the stub or NSSA area.
Default metric cannot be configured for normal areas

virtuallinks.description:
In Open Shortest Path First (OSPF), a virtual link is a logical path that
connects areas of a network that are not physically connected.
Virtual links are used when it's not possible to connect all areas
of an OSPFv3 autonomous system to the backbone area (area 0).
They can also be used to connect two parts of a partitioned backbone.

Virtual links cannot be configured through backbone area or stub/nssa area.

no-advertise-range.description:
Do not advertise the range outside the area.
Summarize routes matching IPV4 address/mask on border routers only.

x-enumDescriptions.TYPE1: Comparable (an OSPFv3 metric plus the external metric)

spi-id.description: Security Parameters Index (SPI) for the Security Association (SA).

auth-key.x-typeDescription:
A custom derived type for special use cases. This type takes a plaintext password and uses
Vault's 3rd party API to encrypt the password. The intended use case is to encrypt and store
customer credentials which will be used later to login to 3rd party services.
auth-key.description: Plaintext authentication key for OSPFv3, configured on area.

auth-cipher-key.description: Ciphertext authentication key for OSPFv3, configured on area.

encryption-key.description: Plaintext encryption key for OSPFv3, configured on area.

encr-cipher-key.description: Ciphertext encryption key for OSPFv3, configured on area.

neighbour-adjacency.description: Sends a syslog message when a neighbor goes up or down.

detail.description:
Sends a syslog message for each state change, not just
 when a neighbor goes up or down.

Successful200.description: Success response returned from the server.

Error400.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Bad request. Invalid values supplied in request.

Error401.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error403.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error404.description: Error details returned from the server.

message.example: Not found. Yang / Corresponding Rule is missing.

Error406.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error408.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error412.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error429.description: Error details returned from the server.

Error500.description: Error details returned from the server.
